Review:
Bought 2 of these for my grandkids. Installed in a 2018 Ford F-150 crew cab. The seats are nice and the kids say they are comfortable. They are easy to install. I do wish they had a strap from the top of the back of the seat to hold the seat more in place as it only has the 2 lower straps on the rear bottom. The seat moves around a little, even when fully tightened. I have these on leather seats and I'm afraid the way the seats move around with kids in them will scuff the leather. Also, in a 2018 F-150 crew cab, the rear upright of these seats will not fit properly with the headrests on the rear seat of the truck. I had to remove the headrests to fit properly.
Update: After having the seat in my truck continuously for 6 months, I took them out for a trip when not needed. First, the seat base design leaves a perminent indention in the rear seats of the truck. The leather wasn't scratched or torn, but the seat foam now has perminent indentions in it and looks bad. Second, upon inspecting the seat cushions of he Diono car seat, I removed the front of the seat cover and found that the seat cushion material is actually a styrofoam material about 1/4 inch think and is really hard. I instantly realized what my granddaughters meant when they said the seats are not comfortable. How could they be? Third, at the request of my granddaughters, I removed the backs of the seats and am now only using the bases and the girls say they like the seats a little better. Lastly, if I buy more booster seat(s) in the future, I will buy a different brand.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster seat
Installation Type: 2 lower straps on the rear bottom, strap from the top of the back of the seat
Material: seat cushion material is actually a styrofoam material about 1/4 inch think and is really hard, seat base design leaves a perminent indention in the rear seats

Review:
I read through alot of the reviews and just like any product online, it's always a gamble. I have traveled on my own with my son and it was a nightmare (don't get me started about that airline!). Anyway, I knew I had to take extra measures to be able to do it again. Which is why I chose to get this product. My son was 2.5 when it was used the first time in Oct 2012. I have to tell you, this is a wonderful product! Yes, going through security can be sucky (with or without this product, with a child). Is it worth it? Absolutely!

I read some of the reviews that mentioned they wouldn't have felt comfortable keeping their kid in the seat while pulling or pushing the suitcase (I have a soft suitcase-which it needs to be filled completely for this to work properly). I didn't have that concern at all! I have another trip this x-mas with my now almost 4 year old. I would rather keep him sitting where I can watch him instead of holding my hand. So we'll see how it goes since he's 40 lbs now!

Update-9/14/14-We again did not have any problems with him being 40lbs. Still love the product.

Review:
I kept going back and forth between the Extend2Fit and 4ever and ended up with the Extend2 Fit because it was more narrow, but I didn't realize just how narrow and compact it is until I installed it. It
Much to my surprise it installed in the middle seat of my 2013 Prius very well, even better than the Chicco Keyfit base for the the infant seat. And the multiple recline positions give wiggle room to find the perfect angle while still ensuring proper recline for age. Install was fairly easy, I did have to put my weight on the seat and pull to get a secure fit but I had to do the same with the infant seat base. Like others have mentioned, tightening the harness straps isn't as smooth as other seats but I've found it works better if you pull the slack out of the straps that go across the legs first and then pull the strap that tightens the harness.
I do not like the square cup holders. Its seems trivial but kids love sippy cups and it'd be nice to be able to use the cup holders for all the cups. Evenflo Symphony has the right idea for this. Also, one of the main reasons I switched my 4 month old over early is because the fabric on her infant carrier makes her so sweaty and uncomfortable that she hates being in there, so I was very disappointed to discover the giant warning label printed onto the back of the seat. The fabric seems to keep her cool except in that one spot and there's been a square, damp, sweaty spot on her shirt every time. If this seat didn't fit so well and have good safety ratings it would definitely be going back. It's only February so I'm nervous to see how that label does during the summer.

Harness Type: Harness straps
Material: Fabric

Review:
This is marketed as an easy remove cover. But actually you have to uninstall it to remove it. Seems like false advertisingâ€¦ If I had known that I probably wouldnâ€™t have bought it. I have two Graco slim fit lx (also sold by Walmart under a different name- true fit 3 I think?) that you can just snap off the bottom cover to wash - so easy. Be sure when you wash the diono that the velcro is velcroed because otherwise it will destroy the mesh lining.

What I really like about this Diono is how spacious it is for the kid - they can push down the sides around the thighs and move around, and no giant things around the head, so they can look around. Whereas the gracos really close them in. I also love that it can be folded for storage! And the pink is so cute! The other downside is that the shoulder strap height has to be adjusted manually (have to at least partially uninstall the seat to access the straps) whereas the Graco adjusts the shoulder straps with the click of a button while installed. The slim profile on the diono is visually pleasing and if the kids arenâ€™t in the car I can haul more stuff on top of this seat as opposed to the gracos. I have a civic and they all fit 3 across.

I have it forward facing for my older kids as would have to buy the diono angle adjuster to get it to take less room rear facing. So I put the Graco rear facing for my toddler as it takes up less front row room while rear facing.

Lastly i like that to uninstall the latch you pull a ribbon loop as opposed to pressing a button. And the padded seat seems really comfy. Itâ€™s definitely less of an eyesore than the gracos but not as practical.

Review: It should be made clear that the base is NOT required to safely and securely install the infant car seat. The installation and use of bases in multiple vehicles is only a convenience, not a necessity.  The Chicco KeyFit 30 user guide on pages 37 and 38 describes "installation without a base" and "installation in aircraft".  As far as I can determine, it is not possible to purchase a seat without the base; however, it is possible to purchase only a base (i.e., without the seat). Of course, Chicco would love to sell you multiple bases at around $85-90 each.  And yes, having multiple bases installed does make it easier to just "snap in" the car seat without having to deal with the seat belt each time; but again, a base is not a requirement, only a convenience.  Please note that the Chicco KeyFit 30 user guide does warn: "NEVER install the CARRIER without Base using a non-locking vehicle belt.  The installation will NOT be secure.  Refer to your vehicle owner's manual for detailed vehicle belt information".

Review:
For so long, my girlfriend and I have been needing to upgrade our child's carseat. Being that our child's legs are long, it helps to keep them lower and allows them to hang freely and not be pressed up uncomfortably against the back of the passenger seat. The cup holders, armrests, and fact that our child can use an actual seatbelt are all added bonuses.
We often go for long car rides and adventures through the mountains, so this really is made for comfort as our child has fallen asleep countless times in just the short span that we've owned it. It looks safe, is incredibly light-weight, feels, and looks cool. As our child gets taller, the back support can rise and even come off and simply transition to a booster seat. Being able to wash it all also makes it so much more durable and clean. We are extremely excited that the latches for the base/booster seat are so easy to clip in and take off. With our previous setup, it was a chore, but this has been nothing but a delight and smiles all around.

For what it's priced, my family and I truly feel this is an excellent product designed to ensure safety, comfort, style, and ease of use for the adults and kids alike. Highly recommended.

Review: I'm on the fence about how many stars to leave. I love that it is small and was so convenient to take on vacation. It was semi-easy to use but I can see how people who have kids who buckle themselves in don't like this so much. It would be hard for a child to do by themselves but I still buckle my 4 year old in so that's moot for now. On that note, this is a pretty bad car seat for a 4 year old. We are definitely pushing the lower limits on height and weight and maybe it works better on bigger kids but it was super unsafe on my 4 year old. The strap in the back would not stay put so most of the time she slid her arm out and let the seat belt go around her waist. Also if your car buckle doesn't already have a lot of backward pull, this isn't great. For it to work it seems like the seat belt already needs to be pulling back against their chest a bit... this device will help lower it to the right height I guess. She sat in the backseat of a minivan and the seat belt did not pull back on her well (it was sort of even with her chest from a side view if that makes sense). Will probably keep it for vacation purposes when she gets bigger but wouldn't use this on a day to day, especially at her current weight and size.

This car seat is wonderful! It was relatively easy to adjust and very easy to install. My son loves the cup holder, and I love that the straps have a place to stay off to the side while I get him into it. The reclining feature is a bit of a laugh - the change is almost imperceptible - but in spite of being barely reclined he was able to fall asleep in it on a long trip recently without too much difficulty (and no head slung forward).

In short, I love this car seat and for that I'm glad, because with how much weight it can sustain I think it'll be in our family for a very long time.

The strap lengthening procedure is a touch more complicated since you have to avoid pulling on the snug harness cord when you are adjusting the tightness. It took me a while to figure that out the first time I used it.
I love the seat design and colors. Sweet and feminine. Overall, terrific carseat for my 1 year old.

Review:
Easy on the eyes. The fabric shell comes loose regularly which is quite frustrating. The sun canopy is VERY difficult to manage and doesn't extend very far. The few spots of Velcro designed to hold the rear of the canopy in place don't actually hold it leaving floppy fabric which can cover baby's face if you try to pull the canopy too far forward.
Also, this model does NOT fit any graco products you might still have from previous children. This led to unexpected costs (totally my fault but I didn't realize this in time or I would have continued using our older infant seat.)

The car seat IS lightweight which is super helpful!!

1. Very wiggle. Even my baby is seating on it, I can hear the seat chattering while driving.
2. Very hard to install. I don't know who poorly designed the base, it asks you to install it with you own safe belt, otherwise it cannot secure a baby over 35lb with LATCH.
When you install it with the safety belt, it costs your an arm and a leg.
3. Very uncomfortable. My baby sweats a lot on back and the material is not breathable. In addition, the hip area is to shallow for a 5-month old baby. And the buckle hits the legs.
Overall, I do not know how the 5-star reviews come out and why so many youtubers recommend it.

Review: This carseat does not properly recline to fit rear facing in our yukon, equinox, or crew cab dodge truck. The harness also loosens significantly after a short drive. I tighten it very snug in my child and when we arrive at our destination 10 minutes later it's so slack he's got his whole arm behind the chest clip with room to spare. The cup holder also only fits in the left side and because our child is rear facing in the passenger side I cannot use the cup holder at all because it sticks out so far we can't close our vehicle doors. And yes, we tried rolled up towels to assist in the leveling and even with 2 thick towels it still would not recline enough. I have ordered a graco convertible 65 to replace it, as the graco 65 we already have fits in all of our vehicles great and seems to be a much higher quality and better overall design.

Review: I have a rav4. This seat is a beast. My son can't buckle himself in because the seat sits on top of the belt. This is the third britax we've owned and I was just not impressed with it. The belt doesn't move freely through the shoulder loop so what happens is you end up with a ton of slack over the lap/chest that doesn't spring back into place. I thought it was rather unsafe. My son could hardly fit into the base with his coat on and everything...the arm rests were in his way and the base is just an odd shape...almost more circular. We took it out and put it into another vehicle for my smaller child but we have to really take our time to get her into it properly. She wouldn't be able to get in it alone. We have a cheaper seat that is so much easier to get in and out of and the kids are able to adjust themselves quickly and properly. I was always a fan of britax, but this seat is a clunky mess.

Review:
This seat has it all!! Only reason for 4 and not 5 stars is that its HUGE! We had a Dodge Caliber and it fit behind the passenger seat only but adults could no longer ride comfortably in the front passenger seat. It has also been installed in a mini van and full size can and fit great! We currently have it our chevy traverse and it is fine behind the passenger here as well, but not the drive if the seat needs to be all the back for tall folks! It also worked well in the impala, but we bought the traverse ;)

As for the features, they are plentiful and awesome! It has independent recline, so if it is installed you just pull the handle and it adjust without ever having to install or uninstall and the recline works for forward facing as well! The base is awesome, and you can order extras, that way you just pop the seat out and into another car at will. Plus those who have worked at installing a big seat know it is not super easy but with the base this seat is!!! It is heavy and very well made! The seat cover comes off for washing without taking the seat out of the car!!! That's right no more threading straps everything is removable whole the seat is in place! This is not an infant carrier so the child has to be taken out and put back in every time you get out of the car, for us this was great it was what we wanted! Our daughter was five months old and about 12 pounds when she stared using it and she fits great! The only other draw back is the cup holder, although you don't have to install it, it only fits on one side and cannot be moved! Again we love this seat so much it doesn't matter!

Review: We've now used this car seat for almost three years. Never again will I buy a carseat with so many hidden crevices and compartments. Kids puke a lot, you can't just wipe and go. The whole 100 pound seat needs pulled out, taken apart, scrubbed, washed, and put back in by someone stronger than I. I need a car seat saver to go over it and block all the crevices from food, puke, potty, drinks, etc. It never gets fully clean, my hands cant reach every hole and crevice. It is a huge pain on a weekly basis.

Review: I am surprisingly pleased with this product. One would think that you would get a subpar car seat for the awesome price of the Graco Nautilus but that is not the case. This seat is very comfortable for my twin 3 year olds. I was initially concerned when we first installed the seat that the straps would be too short. However, you are able to modify the location of where the straps start from the back and that helped alot. One of my daughters is very tall for her age but she sits comfortably in this seat. The head rest is adjustable and isn't too confining for the head. I absolutely LOVE the beverage holders and the little cubbies within the inside of the arm rests. Can't tell you how handy these spots are. The locking mechanism sometimes get stuck when trying to get them out of their seats but I think it's more me than the seat. Overall, I would highly recommend this product to anyone.

Review: We have three of these seats for our boys (ages 5, 6, and 7). These are great seats for travel, as they collapse and fit inside a carry bag. Perfect to throw into your carry on or suitcase! I could also have really used these when we had two in car seats and one in a booster. Many vehicles are too narrow to fit three seats across (unless you have a slim seat like a Radian), but these are perfect because there are no hard plastic edges around it that would prevent it from squeezing in a small pace. Our kids think these seats are comfortable, too. We don't use these as our everyday seats, as I do prefer something with a bit more structure (and has a cupholder); however; these are great when you are traveling so you don't have to lug a big booster around with you. They are also great if you are going to be traveling without a rental car, but will be riding in a taxi/Uber etc. Highly recommend!

I wish it came out farther and that the buckles to snap in weren't as wide. I wish there was some cushion on the seatbelt buckle so they don't hurt him. The ends dig into my son's thighs a little and he doesn't like the initial getting in and buckled up. He's completely content once we get moving though.

Review: Besides being easy to switch between cars, and secure. We were recently involved in a 70 mph crash when a person ran a stop sign and fell asleep. The booster seats high back made the frame of the seat take the impact. We rolled and landed driver side. My daughter was suspended by seat belt, frame of booster took brunt of impact. She has minimal bruising, but because of booster seat design, she wasn't strangled by the seat belt. Highly impressed and happy for daily usages as well. Will definitely be replacing our old one, with the exact same one. I am incredibly grateful and blessed we choose this model and company. God bless whomever designed it.

Review:
I have a now-adult daughter and two grandkids, one a new-born. Because of the spacing of the various births, Iâ€™ve had several child car seats over the years (decades, actually).

I think this is the best one Iâ€™ve ever had.

The first thing I noticed, even before removing it from the box, was its weight. This thing is heavy, make no mistake. But thatâ€™s due to its very solid and robust construction. Frankly, Iâ€™ve never seen anything like it. Itâ€™s a tank! And itâ€™ll protect your munchkin like a tank protects soldiers.

It fastens in place in the car very easily, with a simple click-snap. Bingo, youâ€™re done. No fiddling endlessly with seat belts, trying to reach into deep unseeable recesses for adjustments.

It can be used for kids all the way up to 65 pounds, so itâ€™s good for quite a few years of your kidâ€™s growth. It provides protection from forces that can come from any direction, and allows a lot of ventilation to circulate around your child so he or she shouldnâ€™t become overheated under normal conditions.

I canâ€™t overstate how impressed I am by this car seat. Iâ€™d give it 6 stars if I could.

Review:
Although our baby hasnâ€™t been born yet, my wife and I are gathering everything we are going to need ahead of time. We were able to examine this car seat very well and install it on our car and truck, but we werenâ€™t able to test with our child in it. We have been around car seats all of our lives, but neither of us paid much attention to them, let alone installed one prior to this one. These are our newbie observations:

â€¢ The first and most obvious thing we noticed about this car seat was how cute and cheerfully colored it was, but there is so much more to love about this car seat than meets the eye.
â€¢ It is very well made. Nothing on this seat was cheap or flimsy.
â€¢ It Installed easily and securely in both of our vehicles using the LATCH system, which uses special bottom anchors to firmly secure the car seat in place. Much easier and safer than using a seatbelt.
â€¢ Several things in the seat area detach for easy cleaning or to make room as our child grows, and the fabrics can be machine washed and dried.
â€¢ The seat is designed to be used as a rear facing seat for babies 5-40lbs and forward facing up to 65lbs. We liked that we will be able to use this seat throughout all our childâ€™s early development.
â€¢ The cup holders were removable and could be washed in the dishwasher.
â€¢ The seat is certified to go on aircraft, so we can take our car seat with us when we visit our out of state family members.

This car seat has everything we wanted for our baby and we are so glad to have it!

Review:
There is a lot to like about this seat. First, it looks nice. It doesn't feel cheap, and the materials are soft, and well made. Removing the fabric is easy, and is machine washable as advertised. This is handy, since kids sometimes make small messes, and sometimes throw up all over the entire car seat. Ask me how I know.

My daughter seems to find it comfortable. She falls asleep most rides. She is very tall and heavy for her age. At 18 months she was as tall and heavy as an average 3 year old boy. She still fits perfectly rear facing in this seat.

Now the bad. When you tighten the shoulder straps, it's very hard to pull tight. The straps go over the child's shoulder, and around the back of the seat, where they connect with a metal buckle. This buckle gets hung up on the bottom of the seat. In order to tighten the straps correctlt, I'm forced to reach around the back of the seat, and use my hand to slide this metal buckle over the spot it gets stuck on. It's pretty annoying. I can see other people leaving it looser than necessary because of this design flaw, which could be dangerous.

I want to like this seat, but I wish it worked better. It's not a huge hassle now since my daughter is rear facing, and the back of the seat is open. When she's front facing, it will be near impossible to reach behind the seat to adjust the straps.

Got it in yesterday, took it out of the box and had THE EXACT SAME ISSUE! I posted a pic of the car seat on my facebook and IMMEDIATELY had 8 people comment saying they were having the same problem. Most of them were able to call Graco and get a REFUND. I took this carseat back to the store today and exchanged it for a comparable EvenFlo seat. Very disappointed.

Review:
Bought this for our 2nd child but ended up returning it due to it not reclining. The description says it is suitable for infants from 5lb plus, we tried our daughter at 16lb and it just isn't comfortable for young ones. The 3 level recline does not go far enough back and the whole child is still almost vertical which means if they can sleep the head slumps forward which is dangerous. I have no idea how a 5lb baby would fit inside this car as it wasn't suitable for our 6 month old.

The seat looks better for forward facing kids but we did not have a chance to try it out in this mode. It's also not very clear on instructions, I've put in quite a few seats over the last few years and this one would have to be the hardest. To work out how to tilt the whole seat just wasn't clear, yet the rest of the seat is covered in useless sticker info. Also, the seat belt has to go through a very tight space under the seat cover which takes a long time to feed through if you don't want to take the cover off.

It was ok size-wise, after other reviews I was worried about this but fit inside our Honda CR-V fine. It was a pity as we were hoping this seat would last from 6months until our daughter wouldn't need one any more, but we're shopping around for others.

Review:
This car seat seemed to have everything and received such great reviews that I thought it would be perfect....I was wrong and am not shopping for a new seat.

* This seat is not comfortable for an older child. Once the baby insert comes out, it's extremely hard. Infact, my son has a scar on his lower back, right on the spine from it constantly rubbing the spot where the latch is secured to the seat. This is THROUGH all the cushioning. My son has not sat in that car seat for a year and the spot is still visible on his back. I did not realize what was causing this until I noticed my daughter had a scab in that exact spot. Quick fix was to add a cloth diaper under the padding for more support. And it's not just my seat, my nephew has the same spot from his seat as well.

* The crotch strap is really close to the back. This is a huge pain every time my 3 year old gets in the seat. I have to dig under her to find it. My son, who is skinny and short for his age, complained a lot about this strap so I eventually moved him to a new booster. I was attempting to get more use out of this Nautilus by giving it to my daughter. But the crotch strap is a paint for her as well.

* It's not comfortable for long trips, there's no padding, too upright, might be okay for an older child who can sit more upright, but I would NOT recommend this for kids under four.

* The release is sometimes difficult to open. This can be a good thing if you have a houdini child, but when I'm hanging off the back of my driver's seat trying to release her seat belt so she can jump out for school it can be a real pain.

On the plus side, I have washed the covers multiple times and it's held up great in the wash. The cupholder is great (I wish they would put in an insert that could slide out to go in the dishwasher though), as is the hidden toy cubbies.

If you do only local driving, this is a great, inexpensive car seat that will last many years. However, if you tend to drive for an hour or more quite often, I would recommend looking elsewhere. I wish I had known, it would have saved me a lot of money.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Forward Facing  
Weight Range of Child: older child, kids under four, 3 year old  
Harness Type: crotch strap  
Material: cushioning, padding, covers, cloth diaper
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The seat accommodates older children and kids under four, including three-year-olds.  
It provides a forward-facing orientation.  
The harness includes a crotch strap.  
The materials offer cushioning and padding, and the covers are made of cloth diaper fabric.

Review:
I picked this car seat out before my son was even born! I love it so much. It is SOOOO easy to install. I have it installed in my Toyota corolla. I do have to use a large pool noodle to make it level, but it is such a great car seat. So easy to adjust the straps, my son always looks so comfortable in it. We only had one car seat for a while so we were always switching cars, and I have to say, if I had to do that with any car seat, I'm glad it was this one. It is SO easy, just click the things onto the bars in the seat and push down until it's tight! So much easier than the ones you have to pull on the strap to get tight. I can never do those by myself. The cup holders are great because they fit all different size cups thanks to the elastic! I would recommend this car seat over and over again!

If I had to complain about anything at all it would be that the extra padding in the seat, like the top insert feels like it won't last very long. Just feels like it may get smashed over time and not be as cushy. But that's not really a huge deal to me.

Review:
Like the seat. It seems sturdy and well constructed. The seat cushion feels soft. One improvment on the head support cushion would be a way to keep it up behind the back part of the cushion.

My main complaint is the straps used to secure the seat with tethers. Tightening these is difficult. You have weigh the seat down in order to pull the tethers tight. Also, when releasing them you have to again push the seat down against the car seat to make the tethers loose.
When the strap is loosened you can press in the release button and get it loose. But it requires way too much work to do this. If you are leaving the seat installed this will not be a problem.

Review:
This car seat is far superior to any car seat we have owned and is worth every penny. In fact, I would say it is a bargain for its quality. With 4 kids, we have owned 2 infant seats, 2 convertible, and 4 boosters, all from manufacturers. This Britax Roundabout is, by far, the most sturdy and comfortable. Here are the characteristics that set it apart from the others:

1. Sturdy / immoveable: We use the LATCH system and once it is in place, it does not move. No jiggling and wiggling.

2. Comfort: The engineers at Britax really THOUGHT about the comfort of the child and include such things as extra padding in the back, shoulder pads, and a pad for the buckle between the legs, so that his legs don't get pinched or rubbed. All of these features are added without compromising safety. The material is soft, not scratchy.

Review: Beware. I took my baby to daycare and since she was sleeping in the car seat, I took her in with the carrier. She woke up when we got in so I loosened the straps and took her out and took the empty carrier to my car when I left. When I went to pick her up I noticed I couldn't tighten the straps. My husband had to come and take her home in his car seat and then we dealt with it when we got home. We learned that the belt got stuck in the base and he had to use some force to get it out. This resulted in the belt getting a snag. I called chicco customer service and they took my email to follow up. They never emailed me. I contacted them through their website and it took a week and a half to get the answer to my situation. They explained that I could no longer use the belt but I could BUY ANOTHER ONE from their site. Are you kidding me, this was a malfunction with the car seat and the belt getting stuck in the base. If anyone asks I will say this is my top regret in baby gear. Do not buy this product. Also the carrier is heavier than most.

Review:
I take car seat safety VERY seriously so I really did my research when it came to making this purchase. My son is only 6 months but weighs 24lb and is 30" so we had to get him out of his infant seat earlier than we hoped. We were looking for something that hopefully wouldn't need replaced again that could transition from rear to front facing after a few years. We also didn't want to buy the cheapest seat out there, but didn't want to be duped into buying a $400 car seat either. This seat is the perfect middle ground.
Here's what I really LOVED:
Installation was a breeze
Seperate latch system for rear and forward facing
Comfy inserts for bum and neck support
No assembly required- just pop the two bottom pieces out for rear install and you're ready to go
Not too bulky
Bulky enough to seem very safe
Fits well in our midsize car (2012 Hyundai Sonata)
5 point harness has crotch buckles that insert separately (if you've ever had the ones that need placed together then inserted you know what a blessing that is)
My son LOVES it. No more fussing about

If you're on the fence about buying this seat- go for it! You won't regret it!

Review:
I purchased this seat for my mother-in-law's vehicle. My 6 year old daughter loves the pink and also finds the seat comfortable. The back easily slides up and down to adjust the height with the help of a grip in the back. We love that the cup holders are elastic and can fit multiple size cups. The belt guides keep the seat belt in the correct position on her. It's not bulky like the Nautilus she's in in my car, so she is able to buckle herself. The thin profile also makes it great for either fitting 3 across or if you have 2, there would still be room for a passenger. The seat is also pretty light and easy to assemble so it's great for travel.
Safety Note: Guys....just because a 3 or 4 year old can fit in this seat, doesn't mean they should! Even if they are large for their age, they are still too young. Their bones are not ready and they really should be harnessed. Please do additional research before you make potentially unsafe decisions. This seat is excellent for a 5+ year old that is mature enough for a booster!

Review:
I was a Britax-only person until I received this. Concept is awesome, but it doesn't work the way it's designed. The idea is to lift the seat cushion of the car seat to full opening, pull the seatbelt across the opening and buckle in, then close the seat. Sounds easy right? It's not. If you pull the seatbelt tight before you close the seat cushion, it will not fully shut because the seatbelt blocks the seat from fitting into place. You have to leave the seat belt loose and then shut the seat. But then when you try to pull it tight, it only tightens one of the layers of the folded belt. The top layer is pulled taut, but the bottom layer remains loose with slack no matter how hard you try. This, to me, is very dangerous.

Secondly, the loosening and tightening of the harness straps is very irregular. One will loosen while the other will not, the one that does loosen does not loosen fully, and the straps constantly get uneven where one is loose, but I cannot tighten anymore on my daughter otherwise the other strap will hurt her and be too tight.

Lastly, there are rubber guards on the chest connector that always slide down and refuse to remain in place. It becomes a huge hassle when trying to move the chest connector up to its correct position. I'm worried the guards move the chest connector down out of position, too.

So not only is the design a poor execution and incredibly difficult and inconvenient to maneuver but it's faults make the seat unsafe. We will be returning the clicktight and buying the regular version.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Installation Type: Clicktight
Harness Type: harness straps, chest connector
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should be convertible to accommodate different stages of a child's growth. It should feature a clicktight installation system for secure and straightforward setup. The harness should include straps and a chest connector to keep the child safely restrained.

Review:
I was skeptical, not because of reviews, but how this would work in "real life" going through the airport security.
We just got back and this cart has proved it's worth 10x over. I did NOT want to be stuck at the rental car agency rummaging through cheap car seats as I have in the past. So here's what I did...
I ordered one cart and EASILY strapped in my Britax Marathon 70. Since my kids are happy to walk, they would not be riding in it, I took the other childs Marathon 70 and plopped it right onto the other seat. The side straps don't reach the cart but the top belt reaches and all just cinch that real tight and you now have both seats on 1 rack. It was so good we used it as a cart to pull around our carry on with no tipping or other problems.

Security was a breeze. We told the ticket counter we needed to gate check the seats which was fine (AirTran). When we got to security, I motioned right away to the TSA guy these were oversize and he took it through the door. On the way out the one guard asked I separate the seats (1 minute later, done), on the return they said it was fine as is. They took it aside, hand checked it while me and the family walked through. No problems.

At the gate, we went straight to the counter to get tags for the seats, and folded up the cart for overhead carry one - and that was that, next stop was dropping/picking up at end of the walkway. It may have helped we flew off peak times so we didn't encounter lines.

Seat Type: Rear Facing, Forward Facing
Installation Type: strapped in, side straps, top belt, cinch
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:

The handle is a great feature. Easy for grandparents/people with little carseat knowledge to use. My son says it's comfortable as well. The collapsible cup holders are also a good feature. 10/10 would reccomend this booster. It's worth the price even though it's more than most backless boosters. You can't put a price on peace of mind.

Review: My husband and I are budgeting and tight on money considering he recently graduated from the University and is job hunting while I raise our 1st born son, but when it came down to a car seat we did not hesitate about prices! Of course we bit our nails in "yikes" pricey. But we ordered the "open box" Britax Advocate car seat with zero doubt in mind. Our son is our own miracle baby, and if we are blessed with only 1 child,  due to my infertility, we will gladly do everything within our parent responsibility to keep him safe. He's a big boy, and hates being strapped down, but this car seat is "roomy", cozy, soft- bueno! Worth every penny. There are many crazy, hater folks out there on the roads, best to be wise and do the best part we can in being safe. This was a 2 thumbs up buy. We do not regret it. We will be frugal with other things, but not with this. Good buy.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: Convertible
Weight Range of Child: big boy
Material: cozy, soft
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The seat accommodates a growing child. The seat feels comfortable and gentle.

Review:
All around, this seat was a no for us.

(1) Latch is impossible. Maybe it works better for others based on their type of vehicle, but I could NOT get this to tighten down using the Latch system in our Acura RDX. I finally caved and asked my husband for help. I was pushing on the seat with all my might while my husband pulled the strap with all his might (we're not weaklings!) and we were barely able to tighten it down. Moving the seat between vehicles, or leaving it at daycare for field trips, could absolutely not happen.

(2) The dreaded head-flop. I drove my daughter (18 months old) to school in it this morning and noticed that she just didn't look comfortable. Even with the seat reclined back to the 3 position she was still leaning forward. She fell asleep on the drive and immediately her head fell forward. Ugh.

(3) Straps are difficult to tighten and the chest buckle is flimsy and difficult. And the seat buckle is really bulky and difficult to keep out of the way when you're putting your kiddo in.

Needless to say this is going back and I just ordered the Graco 4-ever. Was hoping for a carseat that was less expensive but still safe and effective, but I'd rather spend the money and get something that really works. I'm surprised this seat has the positive reviews that it has. We weren't impressed.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Installation Type: Latch is impossible; could NOT get this to tighten down using the Latch system; barely able to tighten it down.
Harness Type: Straps are difficult to tighten; chest buckle is flimsy and difficult; seat buckle is really bulky and difficult.
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat needs to be easy to install securely using the Latch system. The harness straps need to be easy to tighten. The chest buckle needs to be sturdy and easy to use. The seat buckle needs to be a manageable size and easy to operate.

Review:
We've had our Safety First seat for less than a year when the straps started becoming impossible to tighten. The exchange process was time consuming (about 1 month) but the customer service folks were nice atleast. We have had our 2nd one for about 5 months and it has already become unusable. The left strap doesnt tighten at all. If my daughter falls asleep or leans over the only thing keeping her in the seat is the right strap--when that one works- its iffy.
I have asked the company for a full refund because I dont want another product that will break in a few months. I will update how refund progresses.
**Update: The company refuses to give full refund even though they sold inferior product. TWICE. Definitely making sure all my other mom friends do not buy garbage.

Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The harness straps need to be consistently easy to tighten.
It is acceptable if the harness straps sometimes become difficult to tighten over time.
It is acceptable if one harness strap does not tighten at all.
It is acceptable if the other harness strap only tightens unreliably.

Review:
I just completed a 3500 mile road trip with my daughter in this seat. Absolutely no complaints from her (about the seat anyway.) We moved my daughter (3 1/2) up to the Frontier out of a Britax Roundabout. The Frontier fits her much better and the armrests and retractable cup holders are nice. I preferred the nylon seat fabric on the Roundabout for cleanup, but this seat fabric seems to be doing well so far for snack crumbs and pet hair. The minimal use of velour reduces pet hair sticking as well.

I love that the straps, buckles, etc are identical to the Roundabout (now used rear-facing for my 8mo old.) The stow-away feature for the LATCH clips is fantastic for dragging this thing through and airport and not having straps dangling everywhere. The automatic shoulder strap height adjustment with the head rest is also a great feature. No complaints so far.

Review:
We bought this one for our second vehicle; the one the kiddo will be in less. Our main vehicle has the Graco 4Ever 4-in-1, which I love.

This Safety 1st Car Seat is pretty comfortable for the tiny. I only have two minor issues.
* One - the click-in straps for the rear-facing direction don't get tight enough in my Dodge Caliber. Your vehicle may not have this issue. Instead, I have to run the seatbelt through the bottom (where it's designed to go) and click the seatbelt into its normal receptor. Then I have to pull the seat belt out all the way until it starts ratcheting, then get it as tight as I can. The car seat is designed for this contingency.
*Two - the child's shoulder strap webbing regularly get twisted in their buckle when I'm trying to get it pulled out from underneath her when she sits down. That design could be a bit better. I rarely have that issue with the Graco seat.

I regularly have to pull the car seat out of the Dodge for the nanny, and reinstall it later. It's not difficult, just takes a few minutes.

Besides that, it seems safe and comfortable. The only two things that truly matter.

Harness Type: shoulder strap

Cons:

Review:
If you are a serious safety person, buyer beware. In general, this is a well built product with good looks and nice, comfortable material but it has an issue with the belt guide. There is a long story here but the short version is that Diono has not worked out the problem with the belt guide (please note the date of my review) which doesn't reliably retract when a child leans forward and then back. I bought two of these and they were both slow to retract, one worse than the other. Diono sent me their "fix," a new headrest with a supposed redesign. The replacement headrests and belt guide looked identical to my eye but the company rep. told me her engineer inspected my emailed photos and could see the difference. (I thought they sent me the old ones by mistake.) So, I installed the new headrests. One seat performed the same - okay just a little slow to retract. The other performed much worse than the original, binding up and not retracting when my son leaned forward then back. After almost a month total of back and forth at this point, we had a long driving trip coming up in a few days so I decided to reinstall the original headrest. It isn't perfect but it did better than what they called their "fix." I am a safety person and I don't love that we have this product with a question surrounding it. Buyer beware. I wouldn't buy these boosters again. Take a look at the difference between where the belt guide is for the Graco products and where they are for the Diono Monteray (tucked behind the headrest wings) and it will explain why the seat belt can't glide freely. The Monterey would be a great product with the Graco belt guide design.

Update: 6/19/12 I sent my two Diono Monterey seats back. I may never see the $69 in return shipping but I figure my kids are worth more than that. I ended up losing my last thread of confidence in the boosters after braking hard when a vehicle stopped short in front of me. I asked my 5 year old son if he was okay and he said, "My head almost hit the back of your seat, Mommy." That was it for me. I ordered the older version of this seat instead - Sunshine Kids, Monterey, as another reviewer suggested. It's almost exactly the same seat but the belt guides are bigger and lower allowing the seat belt to glide well. I am very satisfied.
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: booster
Installation Type: belt guide
Harness Type: seat belt
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The child car seat is easy to install using the vehicle's seat belt. The booster seat design is suitable for the child's size and growth. The belt guide provides secure and correct positioning of the seat belt. The transition to using the vehicle's seat belt as the harness is straightforward.

BUT the reality is that one of those obstacles always seems to be present when you are trying to wrestle your kid into the car making it just a little harder than it should be.  So far we have used this only rear facing for infant and toddler and taken it on an extended road and plane trip and have been happy with it.

Others will say that it is easy, and that is because all of the fabric pieces come off to throw in the wash. That part is good, but thereâ€™s so many nooks and crannies and pieces of moving parts that when your child throws up, which all of us know will happen multiple times. It is incredibly difficult to wash, I spent hours trying to clean it up after my daughter threw up one time.

So I understand the need for all the moving parts, but they need to think of a better way to protect them from things like snacks falling into crevices and spit up. Also it is fairly difficult to install, and very complicated to operate.

Maybe I'm a little OCD but I don't like that my car seats don't match. Other than that it's super comfortable. The cup holder is a must and my kids really use that. Review:
We bought a Radian RXT in 2018 for our second child and loved it. It is easily the most secure car seat I have ever strapped my kid into, and we have owned a lot of Graco and installed in several different models and types of car. Also the easiest install, I've fought for more than 30 minutes in my mom's Ford Explorer with Graco and wanted to set the car on fire afterward for her making me move it over in 105 degree Texas weather. It is heavy, but I install mine and won't move it for any force in heaven or hell unless I am flying, so its not like I do a daily ruck march with it.

Unfortunately, Diono is charging the same price they did for once a premium fabric car seat cover and giving you a crappy, thin car seat cover. Just feeling the difference between the two year models, you can tell they downgraded for the 3RXT severely since putting out the RXT. It has less padding, it is much thinner and I don't see how it isn't going to pill in the wash. My kid is going to destroy it.

I've included pics of old versus new for reference, but most of it is in the "feel".

I find this very disappointing, because you want a quality fabric in a "upper trim" series car seat that is supposed to last 10 years and costs $300. It's the same cheap, slick microfiber that I have on a couple of wal-mart $30 booster seats, or on universal car covers. I imagine it will turn green/gray in the sun just like those did. My Radian RXT is the same color it was when I bought it and even at two years older, looks better and its been washed a zillion times.

At first, I thought they sent me a car seat with the wrong cover, because it says "Radian R" and my RXT was embroidered on, not stamped on the fabric like this one. It also shows on the box as "Radian RXT", so I think my confusion is reasonable. Then I looked at the pictures on their website and Amazon. Nope. They are all universally the same crappy fabric across the entire Radian series.

Shame on you, Diono, car seats are expensive enough when you have to replace them constantly as you have kids, or have more than one so you aren't dealing with the logistics of switching cars with your spouse or parents just to get kids from point A to point B. And parents could easily save themselves $100 or $200 by buying something a little less "premium".

Removing a star for the cheapness, because seeing it there makes me wonder if they are as "premium and innovative" as Diono claims. Companies that do things well would do well to do it across the board, especially if they want repeat business. I came back because I loved the RTX so much. Not sure if I needed another one that I would come back for a "4RTX" or whatever comes next unless they go back to better covers.

For reference, these install amazingly well in Toyota Corolla, Sienna and Highlander and even the tiny Prius, but rear face in a Prius puts the front seat up too far for anyone over 5'6 to sit comfortably (basically every adult in our family). It will install in a Ford Explorer, but you will still be angry if its leather, cause they really didn't want anyone to get anywhere near their latch to actually use them and they are set too close together, so actually cranking down and getting the seat tight enough is a hassle, but easier than installing a Graco carrier or convertible car seat. Don't let an entertainment package on a Ford Explorer fool you, not a young family with car seats car. :p
Attribute_Related_Content:
Material: crappy, thin car seat cover; less padding, much thinner; cheap, slick microfiber; same cheap, slick microfiber that I have on a couple of wal-mart $30 booster seats, or on universal car covers; same crappy fabric across the entire Radian series; better covers

Installation Type: easiest install; install amazingly well in Toyota Corolla, Sienna and Highlander and even the tiny Prius; install in a Ford Explorer; latch; cranking down and getting the seat tight enough

Seat Type: rear face in a Prius
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The car seat cover material is acceptable even if it feels thin, has less padding, or uses a slick microfiber similar to budget options.  
The installation process is easy and works well in various vehicles, including compact models, using the latch system and allowing the seat to be tightened securely.  
The seat is suitable for rear-facing installation in small cars.

Review:
My husband and I purchased the Annabelle color and love it (I consider it unisex color). 100% recommend and Iâ€™ve heard nothing but good things about the Graco slim fit and itâ€™s actually one of the top 3-5 recommended car seats! The bad reviews I think are mostly just the people that got a bad apple out of the batch and I can for sure see how if their package was handled and delivered the way my was. We either carry in our hands or use the stroller so we always end up taking the baby out of the carrier vs the whole thing. This has for sure helped my decision for convertible car seats for my future children!

The handling in Amazonâ€™s care? Not so greatâ€¦ The person who delivered our stuff was great! But our box was COMPLETELY opened no tape down or anything and the bottom and sides of the box was just BEAT UP. Our delivery person said it was always like that since given in their hands. It was no where NEAR visually appealing. One of the straps came in twisted but it was an easy fix thankfully. Thatâ€™s my only down fall with ordering big things from Amazon but I needed the product quickly. Iâ€™m GLAD nothing was broken but youâ€™d think something was the way it looked. Iâ€™m still making sure nothing is broken as we are using it but Iâ€™m pretty sure itâ€™s good!

Be careful some other car seats including other Graco models have a simpler latch system that has a hook with a spring that is very difficult to release.  The latches in the photo are best and easiest and come standard on this model seat.  The seat tilts easily for adjustment, it has two cup holders that can be removed, and is comfortable for baby.  Great budget seat! Very happy with it. We looked at many different seats.  We are grandparents and we bought this seat to haul our granddaughter around in our car because we get to see her often.  So blessed!

Review:
My husband and I spent a lot of time researching booster seats for our son. We really wanted one with the LATCH system install so we did not have to latch it in with the seatbelt when not in use. I drive quite a lot without my son in the car and a flying projectile booster seat is not something I want to deal with in a car accident!

After researching them all, we decided to try this one, the Parkway GTL and the Graco Affix booster. We ended up returning the Graco booster. Both boosters were nice. The Graco had higher armrests, but the fabric was not as nice. The Graco also did not fit as well in the center seat of my Honda CRV, the entire booster was "bulkier." My husband preferred the seating position of the Britax, and my son has an easier time getting in and out of the car with this one.

My husband had also pointed out some reviews that stated on the Graco one of the LATCH system latches could loosen during an accident causing the entire booster to slam to one side, possibly harming the child in the process. This is what sealed the deal for us to keep the Britax over the Graco.

Hopefully this review is helpful. Good luck in your search!
Attribute_Related_Content: Installation Type: LATCH system
Synthesized_Customer_Needs: The car seat should be easy to install using the LATCH system.

Review: I love this car seat!  I already had one but after an accident that totaled my car I decided to replace it and my Maxi Cosi Pria 65 with two more of the Evenflo Symphony.  I have a one year old and 4 year old, both very big for their ages (28 and 56 pounds, with height to match) so it was important for me to find car seats with comfort and longevity.  The infinite adjust feature means with one hand I can adjust the seat as they grow without re-threading straps.  I could also adjust to fit the other child just as easily.  Personally I like this color combination of gray and green.  What I couldn't tell from the photos before purchasing is that the gray fabric on the left and right sides is a sort of vinyl material.  This is a positive for me as it will easily wipe down but it's not where they'll be resting against while seated which would be hot.  I LOVE the quick latch connectors and only wish I'd had them on every car seat we've owned over the last 4 years.  While I'm hoping these are the last two car seats I'll ever need to purchase I do recommend them highly to anyone in the market.  I think the only criticism I have is that some of the fabric is a mesh over a base fabric (the green on the Porter for example). I haven't had any problems yet but it just seems like crumbs might get stuck in the fabric.  I do think this car seat would be very large if rear facing in a smaller car though I haven't tried that.  I have mine installed in a Toyota Sienna minivan.

Review:
My daughter is 7 months old and we recently went on a long road trip and I was debating buying her a convertible car seat since she is very tall for her age and seemed really uncomfortable in her Graco infant carrier car seat. Actually, she screams bloody murder when she gets strapped into the Graco and refuses to sleep unless she's completely wiped out and then she'll take a little 20 minute snooze after fussing for 30 minutes or more because she's tired but hates her car seat....I know they say a lot of babies love to sleep in their car seats but not my daughter! I can count on one hand the number of times she's fallen asleep in the car...since BIRTH....and one of the times she wasn't in her car seat, but rather we parked so I could hold her because she was so tired she was crying but wouldn't sleep!

After doing a TON of research I bought the Britax Advocate, telling myself it would be an investment because we should be able to use it until she's 4 or 5 and we take a lot of long road trips to visit family. I don't know if her other seat was too small for her or if this one with the memory foam is more comfortable, I don't know what the exact reason is but she actually seems to like going in her car seat now. The only time she sometimes cries is when I'm tightening her straps and I think that's just because she hates being restricted. But often I put her in her car seat and she seems happy to be sitting in it and nibbles on the buckle or shoulder pads and then sits quietly while I strap her in and we go on our way. She even fell asleep in it last weekend! Win!

Review:
As a new mom of a 5 month old, I was so happy to see I could get a car seat from infant to toddler for a good price. First off, this car seat looks even better in person.. Itâ€™s seriously so sleek and comfy looking. When I took the car seat out of the box, it had the instruction manual, snack tray, cups and plastic pieces for the anchors. The padding is already placed on the seat, and can be removed for easy cleaning, which is great for messy babes. Also the cup holders have liners that can be easily removed and washed of juice or snacks. LOVE the double cup holders.

For the installation- I usually have the fiancÃ© install the car seats since I get overwhelmed with installing things, but I took a stab at it myself. It wasnâ€™t the easiest for me, and took me a bit of time, but with help from him I was able to install tight, and correct. This will be timely but he said the installation wasnâ€™t too bad and that the manual was definitely needed. After feeling confident that the car seat was nice and secure, we put babe in and he was nice and cozy, took a great nap in it. The straps were so easy to adjust to tighten on him, but the bottom buckles were a bit harder to clasp.

This car seat is used in our second vehicle for now, since our son is still a baby, and easier to use bucket car seat in and out of the house for traveling. We are excited to get all the use out of this 4 in 1 car seat, watching him grow for many many years. Also glad to know my son will be safe in this car seat Incase of accident with side impact protection. I trust Evenflo with my childâ€™s car seat safety.

A downside to this car seat would be not having the sensor safe clip like we have in our infant car seat. Iâ€™ll be sad to not have that feature for upcoming years. That would have been a great addition to this car seat. But overall this is a great price for a car seat you will use for years and I recommend!!

Review:
My only complaint about the seat is the crotch buckle is way too short for a toddler! It is so uncomfortable for my child and it is a huge pain getting her in or out. Britax will not be coming out with a longer buckle either.
The pros: the clicktight is awesome. So easy - especially when used with the seatbelt as it is designed for. The no rethread harness is great. It has higher rear facing limits also. The fabric is nice and padding great. I like that the padding is in sections so if needed I can pull one section and wash it without having to wrestle with the seat to get the cover on or off.
Overall I don't feel I will get as much use out of the seat as I would have with a longer crotch buckle and probably wouldn't purchase it again because of that.

Review:
Britax instructions and customer service is AWFUL! Let me say this--I really like this car seat.
PROS:
- super-easy to install with seatbelt
- the click feature when tightening the straps is really helpful (clicks when straps are appropriately tight around baby)
- decent safety rating last time I checked

CONS:
- Britax communication is horrendous--from their "instructions" to their customer service reps
- the clicktight knob that opens the seat (to remove the car seat) won't turn unless you push down on the seat part...but of course, that's not written anywhere letting you know
- have to buy cupholder separately (after spending $300-400 on the car seat?!?!?!?!)
- the cupholder SUCK, SUCK, SUCKS (very difficult to install and eventually broke trying to re-install it)
- The tether and anchor strap compartments constantly pop open
- if you try to take this on an airplane, it's very heavy. But it doesn't work with Britax's wheeled car seat cart made for that exact purpose.

If you ever have to get in touch with Britax, brace yourself. When I called, I got an incredibly unhelpful, unfriendly customer rep named Brenda, who basically informed me that I've been using it improperly ever since we purchased it! I was calling to ask Britax to explain the bubble diagram on the sides of the seat because, ya know, kinda important to have it installed properly. I found their description of their recline positions to be somewhat confusing. The manual says lighter blue is infant, darker blue is toddler. In another place, it describes the blue for "larger children with head and neck control." In the third place, it says it's important that the seat be reclined to maintain proper head and neck control with "smaller infants." Then a new guideline popped up when their oh-so-friendly phone rep Brenda tells me the bubble should be in the light blue section if the child is under 2 years. I asked sweetheart Brenda if that was written anywhere and she said no. I told her that's a pretty crucial piece of information to not have written anywhere (using my best polite words as opposed WTF ARE YOU GUYS THINKING?!?!) and asked her to pass that along as customer input. She said she would but it seemed that she couldn't care less. Awesome. Since there are NO WORDS on the recline diagram sticker ON the actual car seat describing infant/toddler/age/weight limits, I assumed from the pictures in the bubble area that a younger baby should be reclined further back, but since the standing baby picture is in the darker blue rear-facing and forward-facing, I thought okay, maybe once the baby is 1 year or 20 lbs or maybe standing, you can have it up higher in the dark blue? Apparently, wrong! WTF, Britax?! This is SO important, how could you not have that in writing--like, BOLD writing, too?? It's mind-boggling.

Then I asked lovely Brenda about the cup holder (that I'm sure we all love having to buy separately with such an expensive seat). I ordered it on amazon, but again, their "instructions" have no words, save a few "cautions." Trying to explain the difficulty verbally without being able to show Britax/Brenda was nearly impossible. You can see from the pictures that the opening on the cupholder clip where you slide the holder down onto the car seat appears to be about half as long as it needs to be, as I see it. She kept telling me to just push/shove it down through the crack/gap where the seatbelt would go, and it would "click" in. It never did, and when I push it down, it pulls the gray plastic section of the car seat away, bending it. That seems like a terrible design if that's how it's supposed to attach, or terrible instructions if it's not. I finally got it clicked in, just to find that when I went to close my car door, it hit the cup holder and wouldn't close. This doesn't happen with car seats w/ built-in cup holders (as this seat should absolutely have for the price). So I had to detach it and struggle all over again to put it on the other side of car seat. The rubber piece on the cup holder would hold cups/bottles so tightly that I finally had to take it off so my kiddo could actually get her cup out. Of course, to do this, you have to take the cup holder off again. There isn't a cup/liner within the cupholder that's easily removable, like if drinks spill or the holder gets dirty, so if you ever want to clean it, you have to remove it again. Then struggle to put it back on. It's SUCH a pain in the #*@, I can't truly convey it. I just tried putting it back on yesterday, and after several minutes trying to remember how I'd done it, which I thought was just really jamming it down, as Brenda instructed, it broke. I'm going to call Britax about replacing it... and hope to get someone who's not Brenda.

Another little tidbit they don't tell you is when you push down the cover and it "clicks," securing the seat, when you want to open it, you can't just turn the dial--I wasted a lot of sweat and cussing struggling with that until I realized you need to push down on the cover, then the dial turns pretty easily. I've read other users who've found the same thing. If this is just how it works, why doesn't Britax TELL US THAT?? Seriously, this company needs a friggin' seminar on COMMUNICATION!

Also, as I mentioned above, if you try to take this on an airplane, it's very heavy. You'll want to buy the Britax wheeled cart to go with it... except wait, don't. Because even though that cart is made BY BRITAX, FOR THEIR SEATS, these Clicktights don't have the normal, newer anchor strap connections, so you cannot tighten it onto the cart, meaning not only can your kid not sit in it as you wheel it through the airport, but the seat itself slides off at every turn because it can't be tightened on. My husband and I spent so much time in the airport parking lot trying to figure out how the hell to attach the car seat to the cart that we ended up missing the cutoff for our flight by four minutes. It was a nightmare.

This is the most CAPS-filled review I've ever written. SO ANNOYED with Britax right now. SO annoyed.

Review:
My husband and I were debating whether to spend the big bucks for a Britax or pick this car seat. It has the same or even better ratings on consumer reports compared with a comparable Britax car seat. Glad we choose this one it saved us money. The price is very reasonable and I actually saved almost $60 when purchasing it here on Amazon with free shipping. At my local Wal-Mart in Hawaii they sell them for $161. Yeah for savings!

We have a 2008 scion xB and this seat fits perfectly in the center seat in the back. My husband who is 6'1" drives with the front seat all the way pushed back and it still doesn't come close to hitting the seat. I think though with much smaller cars it may take up a lot of room but what convertible car seat doesn't? So far my 7.5 month old seems to enjoy having more room to move about.

The head rest though doesn't seem to cradle my little one with enough support but a couple of small receiving blankets around the sides helps to contain his head as you would do with a new born baby in an infant seat.

Over all good seat. Will possible purchase another one for our other car.

Review: I have the Britax Advocate 70-CS and the G3 and we LOVE them! Once our son turned 7 months we decided to move him into a convertible car seat and after much research we decided upon the Advocate 70-CS, we continued to use his Britax infant car seat as our back up car seat. As he began to outgrow the back up, I began my search again. Although, we were very happy with the advocate, it is a huge car seat and I thought it might be a good opportunity to cheat on Britax with the Radian, I was enticed by it's slim design. So I began to research the Radian and went to our local store to see it in person. After weighing the pros and cons, I decided to stay with the Advocate. So what keeps me loyal to the advocate you ask? those side protection air bubbles! As of now my son is in the middle but one day we will have another baby and the new baby will have to go in the middle so I want my son to have all the side protection I can give. Yes, it's huge and some people argue that the air bubbles are overboard but when it involves your child safety you cannot go overboard. Also the installation is AWESOME! I'm one of those crazy moms that would rather bring in the car seat than wake my son from his nap, so ya it's huge and heavy but I can carry it and my 25 lb son through a garage up an elevator to our apartment (if the hubby's around I make him do it) and I probably should not mention this but... it also fits in the Britax B-ready stroller so sometimes if I can't muster the strength, I'll just sit it in the stroller facing me. Britax you might want to bust an Orbit! (they have a convertible car seat that attaches to the stroller). Anyway, we are constantly re-installing our car seat and it's simple and secure every time. And I'm loving the new features on the G3 especially the buckle staying up and the hugs strap is cool, whatever offers my son greater protection is good with me!

Review: We've been using this carseat since our little one was about a year old, and we love it. All you have to do is look at and feel it to know it is SO much better than your average plastic carseat. It is bulky, and it is heavy, but I feel that's a good thing, makes for a safer seat. It's easy to adjust, but I usually "click" it more than once. Don't rely on the "click and safe" feature to tell you when the straps are snug enough. They will stop at a coat, etc., so you need to manually snug it around Baby's legs, then make sure straps are snug at shoulders. I think this is way worth the extra money, think of it as an investment in your baby's safety. Also, it should work until Baby is big enough to go straight to a seatbelt, so there's no booster seat to buy later. We did use a "bucket" carseat until Baby got bigger. We're expecting #2, and intend to buy another Britax Advocate, and possibly just an infant insert, so we can try to use it straight from birth. We love this carseat, it gives me peace of mind knowing that I got the best seat I could find. I highly recommend it!

Special Features: Online Chat via ParentLink, Live Video Installation Support, EasyClick LATCH
Review:
This is a very easy seat to install. It works like most seats going in (attaching to the seat anchors and whatnot). HOWEVER, upon tightening the seat, I don't have to sit on it and shove my legs against the driver's seat and squeeze as hard as I can to get it to work correctly. The ratcheting lever is phenomenal and is a really slick way to tighten the seat. It does take a few ratchets back and forth, but it is a simple motion and the length of the lever helps with the torque needed.

Then to release the sides, you just pull on the red straps with very little effort. 10/10 attachment mechanism. 50 stars. Yes please.

I've seen 2 downsides:
1. when I'm ratcheting the seat down, if I'm not careful, I can get the ratcheting mechanism squished up against the seat. This can be remedied by watching what you're doing and adjusting the ratcheting mechanism.
2. In rear facing mode, my kid doesn't really lean back a whole lot. I could tell the first several rides were uncomfortable for them. It's fine and safe, so that's what matters, I suppose.

TL;DR: Nice seat, easy to install, easy to remove, at first may be a bit awkward for your kid.

My one gripe is that it is similar to a model we have in my wife's car that has a much better tether system. This is a clip with straps you have to tighten. My wife's you just clip on and it ratchets automatically as you put  weight on the seat. I would pay just about anything for a retrofit for one of those straps. I've only had to move it a few times, but simultaneously having to put a lot of weight on the seat while trying to pull the straps tight is not an easy thing. I can see why so many are incorrectly installed.

Review: If I could give it a 4.5 I would. Seat is a little heavy which to me means sturdy, safe and will withstand a car accident. I love the shoulder straps and the chest straps that are designed to absorb impact. Installation is a breeze. If you watch a few videos on YouTube itâ€™s the easiest to install while guaranteeing safety and sturdiness. We have 2 cars and just 1 seat for now and moving from car to car is not that bad if you can handle  the weight. The steel frame is visible and makes me feel comfortable. A little more difficult for my wife but we will eventually get two. The click tight feature is really nice. It can sometimes be difficult to pull to tighten but once in place itâ€™s a sure thing. My 14 month old is comfortable and because I have a SUV, when rear facing I can recline pretty well. I do think this seat will be much better once forward facing but thatâ€™s my opinion. I looked at competitors like Gravo 4 Ever and the top of the line Chicco seat and I chose this because all the videos and reviews are focused on safety, safety safety over convincnce and look. I will buy this again and highly reccomend this product as you transition to a convertible seat for your little one.

Review:
So I did lots of research before buying a new car seat. As I kept reading, the Graco Milestone kept coming back as a popular choice within many reviewers, so I decided to order it. So far, so good.
I wanted a car seat that allowed me to rear face for a long time, this one allows me to rear face up to 40lbs. Now, I do have to mention that my kids are on the smaller side, my 6 year old weight 42lbs now, so If its for a child that might reach the 40lbs limit quicker there are other options like Graco Extend2fit that allows you rear facing up to 50 lbs. For foward facing the weight limit is up to 100 lbs.
This car sear has a nice soft material, my son doesnt get all sweaty like he did on his infant car seat.
Installation was very easy with the EZ tight latch system. Just connect and press down so it can get as tight as it can be.
As for size, I feel like its on the bulky side. We have it behind the drivers seat and it doesnt give my husband much space to move his seat back, but, its an easy fix, we can always move the seat behind my seat since Im shorter. Not a big issue.

Also good to note that it is a large seat. We have an F150 so there is more than enough room and no other children. But it would be tight with two of these in there or in a small car.

Review: After reading some of the other reviews, it seems clear that most parents have not dealt with this seat long enough to develop complete disdain for it. I initially loved this seat because my son was tall and he quickly outgrew his infant Snug Ride. I was so eager to get him into a seat that fit him that I picked up the first one at Target that hadn't had any recall issues. My girlfriend also had one so I figured safety in numbers. I was so wrong. I took a carseat safety course and they told us if we ever find ourselves saying we hate the carseat to get rid of it because it is unsafe.well I hate it and it is so unsafe! The straps are always getting twisted and are always uneven so one side will be tight while the other is loose. secondly, the side compartments for drinks and snacks are impossible to remove and one broke off on its own. The chest piece never clicks completely and has come undone several times on its own. The bottom point will click and the top point will pull apart. I can always move it more than an inch even when it is latched and buckled in. It is hard to thread the seatbelt through the hole for it and it never seems to fit my son right even after redoing the straps.I will never buy another evenflo and I can not wait to replace this seat with something that will do what it is intended to do. DO NOT BUY THIS SEAT YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Review:
I'm a car seat psycho (for safety) and I've tried multiples of every version of seat (infant, convertible, HBB...) to find the very best of the best. After 3 different HBBs, this Peg Flex is the holy grail. Here's why:

It doesn't have arm rests so your kid can actually do the buckle unassisted. This is huge because you go from a kid that can do their convertible seat straps to a kid that needs to be assisted in finding the buckle every.single.time. in every boosterthat has arm rests. This seat and the Maxi Cosi Rodifix are thus winners in this category.

The Flex has a more narrow footprint than others because it doesn't have armrests. Need 3 kids to ride? Need 2 to sit next to one another? You're golden. You can park the Flex next to a variety of seats without issue. I have one next to a Nuna Pipa and a Clek Foonf in a Land Rover Discovery (which doesn't have the broadest back seat).

The Flex adjusts in 4 directions so your picky big kid can decide exactly how the seat is best for them.

As with all Peg Perego products, the fabrics are OUTSTANDING. We have the "licorice" version of the Flex, which is a combo of really soft, highly padded fabrics touching the body and edges with really gorgeous leather finished with white top stitching. This seat isn't more expensive than its competitors, buy it looks and feels like it should be. Super gorgeous, even if you have a luxury car-quality interior.

This seat "makes my buns feel the happiest of any car seat I've ever had!" per my 7 year old. If that isn't a rousing endorsement, I don't know what is.

The seat belt shoulder clip is well-designed so that the belt easily pulls through and retracts without issue (this was a constant issue with the RodiFix, the Oobr, and, to a lesser extent, the Britax Parkway in both my Honda Odyssey and the Discovery).

The folding mechanism seems like a "so what" feature, but is actually really handy. I've used it a handful of times in only a few weeks as I've found myself suddenly needing cargo room. I just remove and fold up the Flex, park it on the front floor, and collapse it's 2nd row seat. Super easy and quick. The latch release and install lever is also delightfully straightforward to use.

All in all, there isn't anything to complain about with this seat. Not even the little pull out cup holders. They're not indestructible, but most European-made seats don't even offer an add on option (like the RodiFix). I also don't mind that there's no bottom as I won't ever have to discover some sort of weird goo science experiment at the bottom of one!
Attribute_Related_Content:
Seat Type: HBB (High Back Booster)  
Installation Type: latch  
Material: fabrics, leather
Synthesized_Customer_Needs:
The seat should be a high back booster.  
The seat should be easy to install using the latch system.  
The seat should be made from comfortable and durable materials like fabrics or leather.
